page.title: 07 DAIRY FARMING
page.content: {GRANGE FARM LEGBOURNE This farm of 420 acres is mostly dairy.Mr.Harrison has 121 Britiish Friesian cows and 79 heifers served by Canadian Holstein bulls. The cows feed on grass in the summer and silage, straw,mollasses,sugar beet pulp pellets,maize glutan, rolled barley, and rape seed meal in winter. Each cow has a number and a name handed down from her mother and a check is kept on her milk production and she is fed accordingly.Cows listen to the radio while being milked in the parlour. 2000 litres of milk are collected each day by tanker. A sample is taken for analysis. The milk is bought by The Milk Marketing Board and usually goes to the Hull Dairies. The farm produces 700,000litres of milk per year. Mr. Harrison makes his own silage from grass.
